channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: SNAP benefits set to expire this week. And, Jamaica braces for a Category 5 storm
item.description: Over 40 million Americans will soon be without federal food assistance as SNAP benefits are set to expire on Saturday. And, Jamaica braces for Hurricane Melissa to bring over 170 miles per hour winds.
item.content:encoded:
Over 40 million Americans will soon be without federal food assistance as SNAP benefits are set to expire on Saturday. And, Jamaica braces for Hurricane Melissa to bring over 170 miles per hour winds.

(Image credit: Scott Heins)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: America's immigration crackdown is disrupting the global remittance market
item.description: America's immigration crackdown might have serious financial consequences for a range of countries.
item.content:encoded: America's immigration crackdown might have serious financial consequences for a range of countries.
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: Fight over government layoffs continues as shutdown drags on
item.description: A federal judge in San Francisco will consider whether to indefinitely halt the thousands of layoffs of federal employees announced by the Trump administration since Oct. 1.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge in San Francisco will consider whether to indefinitely halt the thousands of layoffs of federal employees announced by the Trump administration since Oct. 1.

(Image credit: Tom Williams)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Volunteers foster literacy by reading to children and giving them books
item.description: Volunteers with the LiTEArary society read to children who live in "book deserts" and bring them their own books.
item.content:encoded:
Volunteers with the LiTEArary society read to children who live in "book deserts" and bring them their own books.

(Image credit: Credit: Chris Schulz)
item.dc:creator: Chris Schulz

item.title: As Trump talks of designating antifa a foreign terrorist group, experts see danger
item.description: The designation would have, as one domestic terrorism expert told NPR, a "cascading effect across civil society, including social media organizations, civic organizations and everything in between."
item.content:encoded:
The designation would have, as one domestic terrorism expert told NPR, a "cascading effect across civil society, including social media organizations, civic organizations and everything in between."

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Louisiana officials waited months to warn public of whooping cough outbreak
item.description: After a whooping cough outbreak killed two infants, Louisiana health officials waited months to officially alert physicians or do public outreach. That's not the typical public health response.
item.content:encoded:
After a whooping cough outbreak killed two infants, Louisiana health officials waited months to officially alert physicians or do public outreach. That's not the typical public health response.

(Image credit: Rebecca Blackwell)
item.dc:creator: Rosemary Westwood

item.title: 'Washington Post' editorials omit a key disclosure: Bezos' financial ties
item.description: Three times in the past two weeks, editorials at the 'Washington Post' failed to disclose that they focused on matters in which owner Jeff Bezos had a material interest.
item.content:encoded:
Three times in the past two weeks, editorials at the 'Washington Post' failed to disclose that they focused on matters in which owner Jeff Bezos had a material interest.

(Image credit: Pool/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Trump praises Japan's new prime minister during visit
item.description: President Trump began one of his busiest days of his Asia trip on Tuesday by greeting the new Japanese prime minister, and taking her with him as he spoke to U.S. troops aboard an aircraft carrier.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump began one of his busiest days of his Asia trip on Tuesday by greeting the new Japanese prime minister, and taking her with him as he spoke to U.S. troops aboard an aircraft carrier.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Weight loss drugs are bringing down the country's obesity rate, a survey shows
item.description: The Gallup National Health and Well-Being Index shows that GLP-1 weight loss drugs are having an effect: The U.S. obesity rate is at 37%, down from 39.9%.
item.content:encoded:
The Gallup National Health and Well-Being Index shows that GLP-1 weight loss drugs are having an effect: The U.S. obesity rate is at 37%, down from 39.9%.

(Image credit: Dobrila Vignjevic/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Yuki Noguchi

item.title: After 18 innings, Dodgers prevail over Blue Jays in World Series classic
item.description: Freddie Freeman homered leading off the bottom of the 18th inning as the Los Angeles Dodgers outlasted the Toronto Blue Jays 6-5 in Game 3 on Monday night to win a World Series classic.
item.content:encoded:
Freddie Freeman homered leading off the bottom of the 18th inning as the Los Angeles Dodgers outlasted the Toronto Blue Jays 6-5 in Game 3 on Monday night to win a World Series classic.

(Image credit: David J. Phillip)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
